title: Yello - Claro Que Si + One Second@320
description:
1. Yello - Claro Que Si


Their second and a more mature album, great album cover too.
They follow much the same imaginative style as their debut, but this time maybe even more like a motion picture, very visual indeed.
Just listen to the wonderful and dramatic `She`s Got A Gun` and be in the middle of a French black and white movie from the 50`s...
Atmospheric, full of witty lyrics and weird electronics, this is very innovative and playful tunes from the Swiss guys who brought us a number of wonderful albums. 



01. Daily Disco                                                                                                         
02. No More Roger                                                                                                       
03. Take It All                                                                                                         
04. The Evening&#039;s Young                                                                                                 
05. She&#039;s Got A Gun                                                                                                     
06. Ballet Mecanique                                                                                                    
07. Cuad El Habib                                                                                                       
08. The Lorry                                                                                                           
09. Homer Hossa                                                                                                         
10. Pinball Cha Cha   


Label: Ralph Rec.
Date: 1981





2. Yello - One Second


The music is timeless. Each track is different, different style, different language. 
There are great rhythms, some latin, some electronic, some heavy metal. Far from boring:the Latin flair of "La Habanera" and "Call It Love"; the French "Le Secret Farida"; the drum-happy "Goldrush"; the heavy metal-style love song "Si Senor the Hairy Grill". "The Rhythm Divine", which could be a perfect title for a James Bond movie; it&#039;s sung by no less a Bond chanteuse than Shirley Bassey. 
I could go on and on.



01. La Habanera                                                                                                         
02. Moon On Ice                                                                                                         
03. Call It Love                                                                                                        
04. Le Secret Farida                                                                                                    
05. Hawaiian Chance                                                                                                     
06. The Rhythm Divine                                                                                                   
07. Santiago                                                                                                            
08. Gold Rush                                                                                                           
09. Dr. Van Steiner                                                                                                     
10. Si Senor The Hairy Grill                                                                                            
11. L&#039; Hotel    


Label: Warner
Date: 1987
